Parser
public class SyntaxHighlighterParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements Parser

The SyntaxHighlighter parser for syntax highlight.

Author:
Chan Wai Shing

getBrush

public Brush getBrush()
Get the brush.

setBrush

public void setBrush(Brush brush)
Set the brush to use.

Parameters:

getHTMLScriptBrushesList

public java.util.List<Brush> getHTMLScriptBrushesList()
Get the list of HTML Script brushes. See also setHtmlScript(boolean).

Returns:
a copy of the list

setHTMLScriptBrushes

public void setHTMLScriptBrushes(java.util.List<Brush> htmlScriptBrushesList)
Set HTML Script brushes. Note that this will clear all previous recorded HTML Script brushes. See also setHtmlScript(boolean). The highlighter will re-render the script text pane every time this function is invoked (if there is any content).

Parameters:
htmlScriptBrushesList - the list that contain the brushes

addHTMLScriptBrush

public void addHTMLScriptBrush(Brush brush)
Add HTML Script brushes. See also setHtmlScript(boolean). The highlighter will re-render the script text pane every time this function is invoked (if there is any content). If multi brushes is needed to be added, use getHTMLScriptBrushesList() and #setHTMLScriptBrush(java.util.List).

Parameters:
brush - the brush to add

clearHTMLScriptBrushes

public void clearHTMLScriptBrushes()
Clear all HTML Script brushes.

isHtmlScript

public boolean isHtmlScript()
Get the setting of the HTML Script option. See also #setHTMLScriptBrush(java.util.List).

Returns:
true if it is turned on, false if it is turned off

setHtmlScript

public void setHtmlScript(boolean htmlScript)
Allows you to highlight a mixture of HTML/XML code and a script which is very common in web development. See also #setHTMLScriptBrush(java.util.List) to set the brushes. Default is off. The highlighter will re-render the script text pane every time this function is invoked (if there is any content).

Parameters:
htmlScript - true to turn on, false to turn off

parse

public java.util.List<ParseResult> parse(java.lang.String fileExtension,
                                         java.lang.String content)
Description copied from interface: Parser
Parse the content and return the parsed result.

Specified by:
parse in interface Parser
Parameters:
fileExtension - the file extension of the content, null means not provided
content - the content
Returns:
the parsed result
